fgeo.biomass 0.0.0.9002

Add allometric equations to a census dataset.

Source: R/add_equations.R
add_equations.Rd

This function adds columns to uniquely identify each row of a census dataset, and each equation from allodb -- so you can look it up on the database.

add_equations(census, equations)

Arguments

census

A ForestGEO-like census dataframe.
equations

An equations dataframe with unique rowids.

Value

A dataframe with all columns from census plus additional columns rowid, eqn equation_id.

See also

Other functions to manipulate equations: allo_evaluate, allo_find, allo_lookup

Examples

census <- dplyr::sample_n(fgeo.biomass::scbi_tree1, 30)
species <- fgeo.biomass::scbi_species

single_best <- census %>%
  add_species(species, site = "scbi") %>%
  allo_find() %>%
  tidyr::unnest() %>%
  fixme_drop_duplicated_rowid()
#> Adding `site`.
#> Overwriting `sp`; it now stores Latin species names.
#> Adding `rowid`.
#> Warning: Can't find equations matching these species (inserting 2 missing values):
#> quercus prinus, unidentified unk
#> Joining, by = sp, site.
#> Warning: Dropping 5 rows with duplicated `rowid` values.

add_equations(census, single_best)
#> Joining, by = "rowid"

#>  3     3  24200  24200 1702… 1       libe  1701    340     6.40 31811        1
